intro: Euphrasia laxa, commonly known as the slender eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in grassy areas, woodlands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soil. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Euphrasia laxa is known for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in traditional herbal remedies.
